abstract: Display web content in AppKit or UIKit apps, or apps built with Objective-C.
overview:
## Overview

Present a [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebView] object from your custom view hierarchies and load the content you want to display. Use supporting objects to manage cookies, evaluate scripts, control navigation, generate snapshots, and perform text-based searches.

---
source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/webkit/webkit-for-appkit-and-uikit
crawled: 2025-12-02T01:17:38Z
---

# WebKit for AppKit and UIKit

**API Collection**

Display web content in AppKit or UIKit apps, or apps built with Objective-C.

## Overview

Present a [doc://com.apple.webkit/documentation/WebKit/WKWebView] object from your custom view hierarchies and load the content you want to display. Use supporting objects to manage cookies, evaluate scripts, control navigation, generate snapshots, and perform text-based searches.



## Web views

- **Replacing UIWebView in your app**: Find a suitable alternative to handle your app’s web content.
- **Viewing Desktop or Mobile Web Content Using a Web View**: Implement a simple iPad web browser that can view either the desktop or mobile version of a website.
- **WKWebView**: An object that displays interactive web content, such as for an in-app browser.
- **WKUIDelegate**: The methods for presenting native user interface elements on behalf of a webpage.

## Web view configuration

- **WKWebViewConfiguration**: A collection of properties that you use to initialize a web view.
- **WKWindowFeatures**: Display-related attributes that a webpage requests for its window.
- **WKProcessPool**: An opaque token that you use to run multiple web views in a single process.
- **WKPreferences**: An object that encapsulates the standard behaviors to apply to websites.
- **WKWebpagePreferences**: An object that specifies the behaviors to use when loading and rendering page content.

## Web data management

- **WKWebsiteDataStore**: An object that manages cookies, disk and memory caches, and other types of data for a web view.
- **WKWebsiteDataRecord**: A record of the data that a particular website stores persistently.
- **WKHTTPCookieStore**: An object that manages the HTTP cookies associated with a particular web view.
- **WKURLSchemeHandler**: A protocol for loading resources with URL schemes that WebKit doesn’t handle.
- **WKURLSchemeTask**: An interface that WebKit uses to request custom resources from your app.
- **readAccessURL**: The local files WebKit can access when loading content.

## Navigation

- **WKNavigationDelegate**: Methods for accepting or rejecting navigation changes, and for tracking the progress of navigation requests.
- **WKBackForwardList**: An object that manages the list of previously loaded webpages, which the web view uses for forward and backward navigation.
- **WKBackForwardListItem**: A representation of a webpage that the web view previously visited.
- **WKNavigation**: An object that tracks the loading progress of a webpage.
- **WKNavigationAction**: An object that contains information about an action that causes navigation to occur.
- **WKNavigationResponse**: An object that contains the response to a navigation request, and which you use to make navigation-related policy decisions.

## Downloads

- **WKDownload**: An object that represents the download of a web resource.
- **WKDownloadDelegate**: A protocol you implement to track download progress and handle redirects, authentication challenges, and failures.

## Page content

- **WKUserContentController**: An object for managing interactions between JavaScript code and your web view, and for filtering content in your web view.
- **WKContentRuleListStore**: An object that contains the rules for how to load and filter content in the web view.
- **WKContentWorld**: An object that defines a scope of execution for JavaScript code, and which you use to prevent conflicts between different scripts.
- **WKFrameInfo**: An object that contains information about a frame on a webpage.
- **WKSecurityOrigin**: An object that identifies the origin of a particular resource.
- **WKUserScript**: A script that the web view injects into a webpage.

## Page-level search

- **WKFindConfiguration**: The configuration parameters to use when searching the contents of the web view.
- **WKFindResult**: An object that contains the results of searching the web view’s contents.

## Contextual menus

- **WKContextMenuElementInfo**: An object that contains information about a link the user clicked in a webpage, and which you use to configure a context menu for that link.

## Snapshots

- **WKSnapshotConfiguration**: The configuration data to use when generating an image from a web view’s contents.
- **WKPDFConfiguration**: The configuration data to use when generating a PDF representation of a web view’s contents.

## Web extensions

- **WKWebExtension**: An object that encapsulates a web extension’s resources that the manifest file defines.
- **WKWebExtensionTab**: A protocol with methods that represent a tab to web extensions.
- **WKWebExtensionWindow**: A protocol with methods that represent a window to web extensions.
- **WKWebExtensionContext**: An object that represents the runtime environment for a web extension.
- **WKWebExtensionController**: An object that manages a set of loaded extension contexts.
- **WKWebExtensionControllerDelegate**: A group of methods you use to customize web extension interactions.

## Errors

- **WKError.Code**: Possible error values that WebKit APIs can return.
- **WKError**: Possible error values that WebKit APIs can return.

## Deprecated

- **Deprecated Symbols**: Review unsupported symbols and their replacements.

## WebKit APIs

- **WebKit for SwiftUI**: Integrate web content into your SwiftUI apps with new standard views you connect to webpages.
